common: No evidence of fetal malformation seen in reproduction studies with pregnant mice and rats when administered subcutaneously at doses representing approximately 57, 35, and 205 times the maximum daily human dose; adverse fetal effects (increased resorption and decreased fetal weight only at the very high parenteral doses that produced maternal toxicity; use during pregnancy only if clearly needed
Not known whether this drug is excreted in human milk; because many drugs are excreted in human milk, exercise caution when therapy administered to a nursing woman
Do not exceed frequency of administration
Transient burning or stinging may occur with ophthalmic use
Symptoms may occur when tapering or withdrawing the drug

Users of contact lenses should refrain from wearing lenses while exhibiting signs and symptoms of vernal keratoconjunctivitis, vernal conjunctivitis, or vernal keratitis; do not wear contact lenses during treatment
